nodes.rawBody:
---
id: 0
title: NoahTN Portfolio
skills: [JavaScript, React, Gatsby]
---

You're here right now! I picked up React and Gatsby in making this clean and efficient site. 
It uses GraphQL to fetch data from MDX files so it's easy to add new projects. 
I've made the layout modular, so if you clone the repo you can rearrange and remix them as you like.

---
id: 1
title: Rock Immortal Framework
skills: [JavaScript, React, Gatsby, Python, AWS]
image: ./ri_image.jpg
---
An open-source web ticket sales framework. 
I was in charge of the backend and creating the severless microservices architecture, 
which I achieved using Python and Amazon Web Services (APIG, SQS, Lambda). This was a great Senior Capstone project.

---
id: 2
title: Monterey Bay Twitter Bot
skills: [Python, AWS]
---
A Twitter bot created as part of a team of five in the Startup Monterey Bay 2019 Hackathon.
I helped to mentor my team in Python and API calls, incorporating four different sources of information on 
local weather, traffic, and electrical conditions. I'm very proud of my team and I for finishing it.

---
id: 3
title: PictureThese
skills: [HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python]
---

A single page web app that identifies objects in an image
and allows you to translate them into a language of your choice. 
I implemented calls to Google Cloud APIs to handle these functions in Python. 
I played a large role as a mentor to my teammates for the tech stack.

---
id: 4
title: Mahjong JP
skills: [Flutter, Dart]
---
A mobile game for learning Japanese Mahjong that I developed to practice both my game and programming knowledge.
I leveraged Google's Flutter framework and learned Dart as part of its creation. It has dynamic AI opponents and useful tile labeling for beginners. 
Eventually, I want to revisit this project using a more suitable tool.

---
id: 5
title: Stellaformer
skills: [Unity, C#]
---
A mobile game that was my first foray into game development, with efficiency in my mind foremost.
Using Unity and C# for scripting, I set myself to the task of completing development within a month.
With a strict deadline, I was able to focus on the most crucial parts of the game, with time leftover for polish.
